rules.title: Gross vs. net lot area – general calculation and applicability

applicability: All lots used to determine development potential
Applicable at time of calculating lot area for zoning/entitlement review
exclusions: None at the general-principle level; specific excluded area types are detailed in related rules R2, R3, and R4
notes: For most lots in Palo Alto, gross lot area equals net lot area because no excluded features are present

Variables.name: GrossLotArea
Variables.description: Total lot area measured from lot line to lot line before any exclusions

Variables.name: NetLotArea
Variables.description: Lot area used to determine development potential after subtracting all required exclusions

Variables.name: ExcludedAreas
Variables.description: Collection of areas to subtract from gross lot area

Constants.name: DevelopmentPotentialBasis
Constants.procedure: Use NetLotArea, not GrossLotArea, for all development potential calculations

Constants.name: ComputationFormula
Constants.procedure: Subtract all applicable excluded area components

Conditions.logic: Use NetLotArea to determine development potential
If no excluded area types (R2, R3, R4) are present, then NetLotArea = GrossLotArea

hierarchical: R1 is the parent rule establishing the calculation; R2, R3, R4 define specific excluded area components
logical_dependencies: R1 depends on identifying presence/absence of features governed by R2, R3, R4

rules.title: Exclude street right-of-way (ROW) area from gross lot area

applicability: Lots where recorded lot boundaries extend into a public street right-of-way (ROW) or street easement

Variables.name: AreaWithinPublicROW
Variables.description: Portion of the lot lying within a public street right-of-way or street easement
Variables.source: Derived from ROW boundary and recorded lot boundary

Variables.name: ROWBoundary
Variables.description: Edge of the public street easement or public ROW used to define lot area
Variables.source: City of Palo Alto Development Center ROW dimension records

Constants.name: LotAreaDefinitionForROWContext
Constants.value: For lot area purposes, the lot is defined by the edge of the public street easement or public ROW
Constants.procedure: Adjust lot area to ROW edge boundary for area calculation

Conditions.logic: If any portion of the lot lies within the public ROW/street easement, subtract that area from GrossLotArea when computing NetLotArea
Obtain ROW dimensions from the Development Center to establish ROWBoundary

cross_references: Figure 1: Area A (Gross lot area exclusions: street easements)
Local context example: Barron Park area where lots may extend to middle of the street
logical_dependencies: Accurate ROW boundary data is required to compute AreaWithinPublicROW

Ambiguities.issue: Specific measurement units for area not stated
Ambiguities.impact: Unit consistency must be resolved by local standards (e.g., square feet or square meters)

rules.title: Exclude the 'pole' portion of a flag lot from gross lot area

applicability: Lots configured as flag lots with a narrow 'pole' or stem providing access
exclusions: Private access easements located on a lot that provide access to lots are not subtracted from the lot on which they occur

Variables.name: FlagLotPoleArea
Variables.description: The area of the narrow access stem ('pole') of a flag lot
Variables.source: Derived from survey/parcel geometry identifying flag 'pole' segment

Variables.name: PrivateAccessEasementOnSubjectLot
Variables.description: Indicates whether a private access easement exists on the subject lot that provides access to lots

Variables.name: AccessEasementAreaOnSubjectLot
Variables.description: Area of the private access easement on the subject lot (if present)

Constants.name: PoleExclusionRule
Constants.value: The 'pole' portion of a flag lot must be subtracted from gross lot area
Constants.procedure: Identify and quantify the pole portion then subtract from GrossLotArea

Constants.name: AccessEasementNonExclusion
Constants.value: Private access easements that provide access to lots are NOT subtracted from the lot on which they occur
Constants.procedure: Exclude from subtraction any qualifying access easement area on the subject lot

Conditions.logic: If lot is a flag lot with a distinct 'pole' segment, subtract FlagLotPoleArea from GrossLotArea when computing NetLotArea
Do not subtract AccessEasementAreaOnSubjectLot when the easement provides access to lots

Exceptions.description: Private access easements on the subject lot that provide access to lots are exceptions to excluded areas and must not be subtracted

cross_references: Figure 2: Area B (Gross lot area exclusions: flag-lot 'poles')
logical_dependencies: Requires geometric identification of the 'pole' portion distinct from the main lot area
Requires evaluation of easement purpose to determine non-exclusion

Ambiguities.issue: Exact geometric criteria distinguishing the 'pole' from the main portion of the flag lot are not defined
Ambiguities.impact: May require local mapping standards or surveyor interpretation to delineate pole boundary

Ambiguities.issue: Scope of 'provide access to lots' for easements not fully specified (e.g., whether access to one or multiple lots changes treatment)
Ambiguities.impact: Clarification may be needed for edge cases

rules.title: Exclude the creek channel area from gross lot area

applicability: Lots containing a creek channel and/or a creek easement

Variables.name: CreekChannelArea
Variables.description: Portion of the lot within the creek channel to be subtracted
Variables.source: Defined by SCVWD easement or, if none, by top-of-bank

Variables.name: SCVWDEasementBoundary
Variables.description: Boundary of Santa Clara Valley Water District’s easement on the lot
Variables.source: Santa Clara Valley Water District records

Variables.name: TopOfBankBoundary
Variables.description: Top-of-bank delineation used to define creek channel where no SCVWD easement exists
Variables.source: Field survey; may require a licensed surveyor

Variables.name: HasSCVWDEasement
Variables.description: Indicates whether a SCVWD easement exists on the lot

Constants.name: CreekChannelDefinitionHierarchy
Constants.value: Use SCVWD easement to define channel area; if none, use top-of-bank
Constants.procedure: Check SCVWD easement first; otherwise delineate top-of-bank

Conditions.logic: Subtract CreekChannelArea from GrossLotArea when computing NetLotArea
If HasSCVWDEasement == true, define CreekChannelArea by SCVWDEasementBoundary; else define by TopOfBankBoundary
Determining TopOfBankBoundary may require a surveyor

cross_references: Figure 3: Area C (Gross lot area exclusions: creek easements)
logical_dependencies: Accurate delineation of top-of-bank when easement is absent

Ambiguities.issue: Methodology for determining top-of-bank is not specified
Ambiguities.impact: Requires local standard or professional survey guidance

Ambiguities.issue: Measurement units for area not stated
Ambiguities.impact: Unit consistency must be resolved by local standards (e.g., square feet or square meters)
